page.title: 14INFORMATION SYSTEMS
page.content: The new{Central Library,}opened in 1985, has been built to be in the centre of the community, improving and superceding facilities for both adults and children. The{Children's Library has a pre-school area, activity room, study area with reference books, public-use micro-computers and audio and video materials. A{Community Suite offers a lecture theatre, meeting rooms, a coffee bar, toilets and a telephone. In the{Browser Library there are general reading sections, quick-reference collections, Lifelines information, Prestel, video and a public-use photo-copier. The{Upper {Library}has subject-arranged non-fiction sections with study tables individual carrels, data-bases, micros, music and drama libraries with audio and video sets.There is also a {Local Studies}section.
